schema.name: BioSample_ID
schema.description: The unique identifier for the biological sample (e.g. SAMEA1028830)

schema.name: assembly_ID
schema.description: The unique accession number of genome assembly (e.g., GCA_001096525.1)

schema.name: antibiotic_ontology
schema.description: An ontology ID for the antibiotic (e.g. ARO_3004024)

schema.name: INSDC_secondary_accession
schema.description: The secondary accession number in the International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC)

schema.name: collection_year
schema.description: The year the sample was collected

schema.name: ISO_country_code
schema.description: The 3-letter ISO country code where the sample was collected (e.g. THA for Thailand)

schema.name: host
schema.description: The organism the sample was isolated from (e.g. Homo sapiens)

schema.name: host_age
schema.description: The age of the host (empty/NULL in the sample data, but should be a string to allow for various formats or NULLs)

schema.name: host_sex
schema.description: The sex of the host (empty/NULL in the sample data)

schema.name: isolate
schema.description: A unique identifier for the specific isolate (e.g. SMRU2695)

schema.name: isolation_source
schema.description: The specific anatomical source or environment the isolate came from (e.g. nasopharynx)

schema.name: isolation_source_category
schema.description: The general category of the isolation source (e.g. respiratory tract)

schema.name: lat_lon
schema.description: Geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude)

schema.name: AMR_associated_publications
schema.description: The PubMed ID of the publication associated with the data

schema.name: used_ECOFF
schema.description: Indicates if the Epidemiological Cut-Off (ECOFF) was used (empty/NULL in the sample data)

schema.name: database
schema.description: Database of annotation

schema.name: antibiotic_name
schema.description: The name of the antibiotic tested (e.g. beta-lactams, trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole)

schema.name: astStandard
schema.description: The standard or guideline used for Antimicrobial Susceptibility Testing (e.g. CLSI, EUCAST)

schema.name: laboratoryTypingMethod
schema.description: The method used to test the antibiotic sensitivity (e.g. disk diffusion, E-test)

schema.name: measurement
schema.description: The raw measurement value, typically MIC or zone size (e.g. 2, 1, 0.5). FLOAT is used for non-integer numeric values

schema.name: measurement_sign
schema.description: The sign indicating the nature of the measurement (e.g. '==' for exact value, or '>', '<')

schema.name: measurement_units
schema.description: The units for the measurement (e.g. mg/l)

schema.name: platform
schema.description: The platform used for analysis (empty/NULL in the sample data)

schema.name: resistance_phenotype
schema.description: The final result of the interpretation (e.g. susceptible, non-susceptible, resistant)

schema.name: antibiotic_abbreviation
schema.description: A common abbreviation for the antibiotic (e.g. SXT)

schema.name: antibiotic_ontology_link
schema.description: Link to the ontology resource for the ID

schema.name: country
schema.description: Full country name where the sample was collected from. Converted from `ISO_country_code`.

schema.name: geographical_region
schema.description: Geographical region as defined by UN M49. e.g Asia, Europe, Oceania, Africa or Americas.

schema.name: geographical_subregion
schema.description: Geographical subregion as defined by UN M49. e.g.Eastern Asia, Northern Europe.

schema.name: genus
schema.description: The genus of the organism (e.g., Streptococcus)

schema.name: species
schema.description: The species name of the organism

schema.name: organism
schema.description: The full name of the organism (e.g., Streptococcus pneumoniae)

schema.name: isolate
schema.description: Isolate information

schema.name: taxon_id
schema.description: NCBI Taxonomy identifier of the organism

schema.name: region
schema.description: Name of a genomic region

schema.name: region_start
schema.description: Start of the annotated gene

schema.name: region_end
schema.description: End of the annotated gene

schema.name: strand
schema.description: Strand of the annotated gene. '+' indicates the forward strand, '-' indicates the reverse strand

schema.name: id
schema.description: Identifier of the gene

schema.name: gene_symbol
schema.description: Symbol of the gene

schema.name: amr_element_symbol
schema.description: AMRFinderPlus assigned symbol for the AMR element

schema.name: element_type
schema.description: Broad type of AMR element. Normally set to `AMR`

schema.name: element_subtype
schema.description: Subtype of AMR element. Normally set to `AMR`

schema.name: class
schema.description: Overall class of AMR compound as given by AMRFinderPlus. Normally a broad representation of antibiotics

schema.name: subclass
schema.description: Subclass of AMR compound as given by AMRFinderPlus. Can also be set to the same as class

schema.name: split_subclass
schema.description: Subclass can represent multiple individual compounds separated by a '/'. This field contains the individual element of subclass.

schema.name: evidence_accession
schema.description: Accession number for evidence supporting the predicted AMR resistance

schema.name: evidence_type
schema.description: Type of evidence supporting the predicted AMR resistance

schema.name: evidence_link
schema.description: Link to the evidence supporting the predicted AMR resistance

schema.name: evidence_description
schema.description: Evidence description supporting the predicted AMR resistance
